title: Best Practices in File Naming
mainContent:
Best Practices in File Naming
  • directory for the class: for example: 301
  • inside that directory: a directory for the project: for example: vote-tracker, or code-blog
  • lower case is always easier to work with in the terminal
  • dashes (kabob-case), underscores (snake_case), camelCase - no spacing in file names
  • keep your class notes in a separate directory from the project you are working on
  • Most importantly, do not include class notes and sample code in your repo
  • While it is possible to have similar file names, this is not something you should do
author: Darcy Lambrecht

title: Trivia Crossroads
description:
A meeting place for Trivia enthusiasts to find events and other likeminded people in Seattle.

This is a final project for Code Fellows 201d1.

The name Trivia Crossroads is based on the etymology of the word trivia, specifically: The word trivia comes from the Latin word trivium, meaning a meeting of three roads.
author: Selena Flannery, Ivar Lee, Willie Richardson, Michael Sullivan, and David Tolmie

title: Slash Whooo?
description: This is a game based on the cup and ball shuffling game. Instead of using a cup we use a picture of Slash and instead of the ball we use a family of owls under Slash's hat. The game starts off by displaying a start page with option parameters for the game. The option parameters are: number of shuffles and speed. The higher the number of shuffles and the faster the speed, the more points the user will score if they win the game. The user makes their options selection and clicks the start button, which takes them to the game page.
author: A.J. Wohlfert, Ardian Ajvazi, Dan Schwartz, Brandon Feinstein

title: Inevitable Mortality
description: A mad-lib to 'predict' your death. It is not for children. The stories were written complete, and later determined which words would make the stories the most ridiculous as possible when replaced with random nouns, verbs, or adjectives.
author: Brandon Parker, Carson Parker, Sawako Ishida, Melissa Giaime
